Title:
First record of Erysiphe platani on species of the genera
Koelreuteria, Cercis and Ipomoea reveal its host extension
Keywords:
Erysiphaceae, Ailanthus altissima, host range, ITS, 28S
rDNA
Abstract:
Two powdery mildew samples were collected on Koelreuteria
bipinnata (Sapindaceae) in the Chinese Jiangsu Province and on K.
paniculata in Hubei Province. Two powdery mildew samples were collected
on Cercis chinensis (Fabaceae) from Jiangxi Province and Ipomoea nil
(Convolvulaceae) from Jiangxu Province in China. A single powdery mildew
sample was collected on Ailanthus altissima (Simaroubaceae) in Russia.
The morphological characteristics of the five collections are in
accordance with the description of E. platani. A phylogenetic tree was
constructed, based on the combined ITS and 28S rDNA sequences retrieved
from the five collections examined, with the maximum parsimony (MP)
method. The five sequences formed a clade together with other E. platani
sequences deposited in GenBank with 100% bootstrap support. Based on
their morphological characteristics and phylogenetic placement, the five
specimens can be unequivocally assigned to E. platani. E. platani mainly
parasitizes on Platanus spp. These are the first records of E. platani
on Koelreuteria spp., on Cercis chinensis, and on I. nil, which confirm
the wider host range of this powdery mildew species that was already
reported from Europe on Ailanthus altissima (Simaroubaceae), Punica
granatum (Lythraceae) and North America on Acer platanoides
(Sapindaceae), Azalea nudiflora (Ericaceaes) . This is also the first
report of E. platani causing powdery mildew on A. altissima in
Russia.
